FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I get where you're coming from but trauma isn't defined by what happens to you. It's defined by how it impacts on you. I have 'real trauma' from childhood and the violence I experienced. I have 'real trauma' from a driver running me down in a crosswalk. I am also more than comfortable acknowledging that trauma comes in many forms. And yes, trying to survive in a hostile and broken society is traumatizing. It is having a tangible impact on collective mental health. The trauma of others doesn't diminish your own.  Attempting to discern 'real trauma' from 'not real trauma' invariably ends up making it difficult for traumatized people to seek help. A lot of them don't think they deserve therapy because therapy is for 'actually traumatized people who have it worse.' There's always someone worse off and everyone deserves mental health help.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: What is precluding you from ‚Äúaccepting‚Äù people‚Äôs mental illnesses? Do you not believe mental illness exists, or do you not believe the person suffering is telling the truth? I‚Äôm curious.
FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I respectfully disagree. The reason why mental health discussions are seemingly prevalent compared to previous generations is due to stigma. Not too long ago, being gay was classified as a mental illness, and people were being lobotomized for treatable illnesses like PTSD. As science evolves, our understanding of the brain changes, and so too does the social climate regarding the illnesses of the brain. I find this to be positive, in some aspects, and of course negative in others. It is excellent that people who have mental health disorders as a whole can feel less alienated and have more hope for recovery. It is not so great that mental health terms (anxiety, depression, etc.) are being thrown around so carelessly by some that they start to lose their meaning. However, such is life- there are often positive and negative aspects to everything.  Also, you seem to have a misconception surrounding the nature of psychological ‚Äútrauma‚Äù. While yes, everyone is susceptible to the condition, not everyone develops it when exposed to stressor events. Trauma, defined, is ‚Äúan emotional response caused by severe distressing events that are outside the normal range of human experiences‚Äù, ie not everyone goes through traumatic events. They can go through distressing events, or hardships (which is what I think you have in mind) but trauma is different in that it encompasses comparatively more horrific experiences such as violence (physical or sexual), war, terrorist attacks, and so on.  I think it is important that we don‚Äôt minimize the suffering of others and instead exercise considerate behavior, as nobody truly understands what we are going through but ourselves. I think it is also important we educate ourselves to properly do so.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: As the Eldest of Millennials, yeah; ya'll are different.    The difference with the Millennials are a lot us take care of problems in private, inner circles, or with therapists.    We, just like you, used to (and some of still do) look for these ways of 'dealing' with things and seeking support online.  We have found that all this does is help find people like you which might help some, but it might not help others.  You gotta work on the problem, fix it, or mitigate it best as you can.    Each generation has their shit; that doesn't mean that each shit is worse than others.  We find ways to carry on; if you cannot, the result is to simply to stop.  That is why the even older generations (ie, Boomers and Gen X) are telling you (in the ways that they are able) to deal with and get over it as best as you can.  We are all deeply worried about ya'll, and you must find the strength to carry on.  We each had to go through this; now it's your turn.  Face your shit, heal up, and grow.    As far as the bigger things, focus on what you can change.  Make your bed in the morning, have a job, workout or a take a walk, change the things that are in your immediate orbit.  Now, specifically about the bigger things, wait your turn and learn for now.  The time will come for all of you to completely take the torch on running the world; you're not there yet.  Fix yourselves, become better able to handle more, and take the torch when it's time.    Also, from one dude rattling his cane, get offline, ya'll.  No matter how awesome it is here, everyone's mental suffer while being online more (look up various studies to confirm this on your own time).  Hang out with your friends, talk to a pretty girl/handsome dude (w/e you're into), play a game outside, ride on the merry-go-round, etc. Go. Do. Something. Else. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Older Gen Z (born 1998 so I'm also on the cusp) here. While trauma is not a competition and some things can be improved upon, one does have to learn how to cope with life. It is stressful and scary, but obsessively dragging yourself down by using harmful coping mechanisms is not going to fix it. I fail to see how oversharing on social media helps people overcome trauma, and learn healthy coping skills. And I'm saying this as someone who used to overshare.  As far as the news goes, sometimes one has to stop paying attention to the mainstream media (which btw tends to lie/play into inflated narratives) and focus on their own life and what they have control over. I'm not saying it is bad to be aware of what is going on in the world, ignorance is not the answer. One just has to recognize what they can control/contribute to and what they cannot control/contribute to.  I suggest cutting back on social media because most of what is on there is exaggerated, misleading, or just downright fabricated. It'll just drag your mental health down further. I understand it is not easy, but it is doable. I'm saying this as someone who has done it, I no longer use TikTok or Facebook (except for Messenger, which is just your private messages, you do not see posts or ads or anything). No, trauma is not the fault of the individual. But one has to recognize the habits it creates and how these habits drag them down. It is necessary to look into healthy ways to cope instead of continuing with habits that are detrimental to their physical and mental health. Yes, mental health and physical health are connected, because when I was at my lowest mentally I ate like sh*t & weighed 250lbs. Call me "fatphobic", idc. I know I felt like crap and am glad I lost weight. Trauma itself is not a "pathology" but it can lead to health issues that can be life-long if one is not careful. And as far as the older generations go, I understand how they are. I know how condescending and insensitive some of them can be. We all have at least one insensitive "boomer" in our lives. But, we do have to consider that they lived in a different time, and dealt with similar issues in different ways. I hate to play the comparison game, but many of our great-grandparents and great-great-grandparents had to live through world wars and didn't have the tools to complain about it online. They just had to go on with life, whether that meant going to fight for our country or holding things down on the home-front. Now, I am also not saying you have to sit there and deal with horrible behavior, especially if the person is legitimately abusive. Sometimes, going no contact is necessary. But it is also vital to recognize generational and individual differences, as it helps one understand that the other person's behavior is not necessarily about them.  I am also really sick of the anti-capitalist bs. Yes, there is a darker side to capitalism that has bred a disconnect. Yes, greed is a terrible thing. But it is also obvious that communism/socialism is not the answer some think it is, there are many examples of how those ideologies have harmed nations and people throughout history. Like you said, healing is not only possible, it is NECESSARY. It takes work, and some people do not want to do that work. This behavior is common in Gen Z, but not exclusive to us. I know Gen-Xers (and people even older than that age range) who do not want to heal bc they know if they act like a perpetual victim they'll get sympathy and attention. Again, this behavior is less common in older generations due to the aforementioned differences, but that does not mean its exclusive to a single generation.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: We're Gen-Z. We also have OSDD-1b (Otherwise Specified Dissociative Disorder). For those who don't know, DID/OSDD/UDD are formed from severe, repeated trauma during childhood, before the ages of 7-9. DID, UDD, and types 1, 2, and 3 of OSDD include having alternate states of identity, or alters for short. When a child is first born, and growing up, they slowly get personality traits/identity traits that eventually form into a full personality at ages 7-9. If a child experiences this severe, repeated trauma, amnesia and dissociative barriers get put up in between these personality/identity states. This causes said personality/identity traits to not be able to fully integrate, and they form off as their own states of identity. There isn't an "original"; there might be an alter that is in control of the body, or fronting, mostly, but that doesn't mean they're the "original". There isn't one. Alters can form at any age (if you already have DID/OSDD/UDD, I mean; you can only get it before the ages of 7-9. After that, it's impossible for it to form). They split (or form) when someone experiences more high stress or trauma. Alters of fictional characters are possible as well; if someone is going through trauma or high stress, they might have an escape from some type of media. This might case a fictive (alter of a fictional character) to form. They can also form from INTENSE attachments/interests in a media. (there's also factives, which is a fictive of a real person, and introjects, which is the umbrella term that fictives/factives formed from).   anyways. We've been told so many times that we didn't even have it that bad, or that our trauma wasn't nearly as bad as we were making it out to be.  If that were true, I wouldn't be here. If that were true, our mind wouldn't have literally been ripped apart to try to protect itself. -Chet

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Don't just find a therapist. Find a therapist that understands learned helplessness. Validation is useful in a state of emergency to get someone to a point of calm and rationality. After the patient has the skills to calm themselves, then they can begin to look at themselves objectively and unpack what they are doing to contribute to the distress. Focus on what you can control instead of what you cannot control. Therapy is supposed to be challenging, not comfortable. Life is supposed to be challenging, too. It is normal to feel stressed out. It is not normal to think you're powerless against it. For example: if the news is stressing you out, stop watching the news. Grow above media addiction. It's not easy and no one who understands will say that it is. We can all do hard things.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Capitalism profits off of need. The way to make more money is to create more need. Social media has become a vehicle to create need. It does this by creating box's, these box's make it easier to market the product. Thus the need for boxing identities and people. If they make you feel like you are lacking something as an individual, as a human being and then tell you that something will fix that or make you better you will buy it. That could be why all of these aesthetics or cores have been trending, because we have been exposed to so much media and marketing from young ages (speaking towards gen-z specifically, although it can be true for people of all ages) that we dont even have time to think for ourselves and get to know who we are outside of it. People are starting to wake up from that, like you were mentioning with the identity crisis. Even without social media its extremely normal to have an identity crisis around teen and young adult age, but social media exacerbates it. We as a society connect through social media now, but the algorithm only works if they have a way to identify the type of content so they know what to give you. What people are trying to do now like you were saying, gaining knowledge and doing things rather then purchasing items is a good step for people. They are realizing the buying things wont make you happy with yourself. The downside is that they still feel the need to cater to social media algorithms, it no longer being about a type of person who buys these type of things but a vibe and way of being. A much harder thing to market but it is doable. Overall in my personal opinion deleting your social medias might be the best way to really get to know yourself outside of your online persona, who are you without people watching? I think people would be a lot happier that way. But I think people keep coming back to social media because of the community. There are an extreme lack of third spaces, let alone ones that you dont have to pay for. I think its important as a society we need to foster the growth and restoration of the physical community, but I question if that will be doable. Culture has drastically changed and I'm not sure people will be willing to make the sacrifices it take to have a community. Anyway if you've read this far thanks, your video was very good.

Part  2 For it is written Proverbs 12:4  4 An excellent wife is the crown of her husband, but she who brings shame is like rottenness in his bones.  Proverbs 18:22  22 He who finds a wife finds a good thing and obtains favor from the Lord.  Proverbs 14:1  1 The wise woman builds her house, but with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.  Proverbs 19:14  14  House and wealth are inherited from fathers, but a prudent wife is from the Lord.  Proverbs 21:9   9 It is better to live in a corner of the housetop than in a house shared with a quarrelsome wife.  Psalm 85:10  10 Steadfast love and faithfulness meet; righteousness and peace kiss each other.  Hebrews 13:4   4"Marriage is to be held in honor among all, and the marriage bed is to be undefiled; for God will judge the sexually immoral and adulterers".   Colossians 3:19 18 Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord. Husbands, love your wives, and do not be harsh with them.  19 Husbands, love your wives and do not be harsh with them.  1 Peter 3 1Wives, in the same way submit yourselves to your own husbands so that, if any of them do not believe the word, they may be won over without words by the behavior of their wives, 2when they see the purity and reverence of your lives. 3Your beauty should not come from outward adornment, such as elaborate hairstyles and the wearing of gold jewelry or fine clothes. 4Rather, it should be that of your inner self, the unfading beauty of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is of great worth in God‚Äôs sight. 5For this is the way the holy women of the past who put their hope in God used to adorn themselves. They submitted themselves to their own husbands, 6like Sarah, who obeyed Abraham and called him her lord. You are her daughters if you do what is right and do not give way to fear. 7Husbands, in the same way be considerate as you live with your wives, and treat them with respect as the weaker partner and as heirs with you of the gracious gift of life, so that nothing will hinder your prayers.  Proverbs 31 Epilogue: The Wife of Noble Character 10 A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies. 11 Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value. 12 She brings him good, not harm, all the days of her life. 13 She selects wool and flax and works with eager hands. 14 She is like the merchant ships, bringing her food from afar. 15 She gets up while it is still night; she provides food for her family and portions for her female servants. 16 She considers a field and buys it; out of her earnings she plants a vineyard. 17 She sets about her work vigorously; her arms are strong for her tasks. 18 She sees that her trading is profitable, and her lamp does not go out at night. 19 In her hand she holds the distaff and grasps the spindle with her fingers. 20 She opens her arms to the poor and extends her hands to the needy. 21 When it snows, she has no fear for her household; for all of them are clothed in scarlet. 22 She makes coverings for her bed; she is clothed in fine linen and purple. 23 Her husband is respected at the city gate, where he takes his seat among the elders of the land. 24 She makes linen garments and sells them, and supplies the merchants with sashes. 25 She is clothed with strength and dignity; she can laugh at the days to come. 26 She speaks with wisdom, and faithful instruction is on her tongue. 27 She watches over the affairs of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness. 28 Her children arise and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her: 29 ‚ÄúMany women do noble things, but you surpass them all.‚Äù 30 Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised. 31 Honor her for all that her hands have done, and let her works bring her praise at the city gate.   1 Corinthians 7:2-11  2 But since sexual immorality is occurring, each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband. The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband. The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife. Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control. I say this as a concession, not as a command. I wish that all of you were as I am. But each of you has your own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that. Now to the unmarried and the widows I say: It is good for them to stay unmarried, as I do. But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with passion. To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband. But if she does, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.  Psalm 31  Do not spend your strength on women, your vigor on those who ruin kings. 4 It is not for kings, Lemuel‚Äî it is not for kings to drink wine, not for rulers to crave beer, 5 lest they drink and forget what has been decreed, and deprive all the oppressed of their rights. 6 Let beer be for those who are perishing, wine for those who are in anguish! 7 Let them drink and forget their poverty and remember their misery no more. 8 Speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves, for the rights of all who are destitute. 9 Speak up and judge fairly; defend the rights of the poor and needy.

Part 4 For it is written Mark 7 20 He went on: ‚ÄúWhat comes out of a person is what defiles them. 21 For it is from within, out of a person‚Äôs heart, that evil thoughts come‚Äîsexual immorality, theft, murder, 22 adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly. 23 All these evils come from inside and defile a person.‚Äù  Luke 16:18 18 ‚ÄúAnyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.  Mark 10:19 19 You know the commandments: ‚ÄòYou shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not defraud, honor your father and mother.‚Äô‚Äù  Luke 18:20 20 You know the commandments: ‚ÄòYou shall not commit adultery, you shall not murder, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.‚Äô‚Äù  Romans 13:9 9 The commandments, ‚ÄúYou shall not commit adultery,‚Äù ‚ÄúYou shall not murder,‚Äù ‚ÄúYou shall not steal,‚Äù ‚ÄúYou shall not covet,‚Äù and whatever other command there may be, are summed up in this one command: ‚ÄúLove your neighbor as yourself.‚Äù  2 Peter 2  False Teachers and Their Destruction 1 But there were also false prophets among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive heresies, even denying the sovereign Lord who bought them‚Äîbringing swift destruction on themselves. 2 Many will follow their depraved conduct and will bring the way of truth into disrepute. 3 In their greed these teachers will exploit you with fabricated stories. Their condemnation has long been hanging over them, and their destruction has not been sleeping. 4 For if God did not spare angels when they sinned, but sent them to hell, putting them in chains of darkness to be held for judgment; 5 if he did not spare the ancient world when he brought the flood on its ungodly people, but protected Noah, a preacher of righteousness, and seven others; 6 if he condemned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah by burning them to ashes, and made them an example of what is going to happen to the ungodly; 7 and if he rescued Lot, a righteous man, who was distressed by the depraved conduct of the lawless 8 (for that righteous man, living among them day after day, was tormented in his righteous soul by the lawless deeds he saw and heard)‚Äî 9 if this is so, then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trials and to hold the unrighteous for punishment on the day of judgment. 10 This is especially true of those who follow the corrupt desire of the flesh and despise authority. Bold and arrogant, they are not afraid to heap abuse on celestial beings; 11 yet even angels, although they are stronger and more powerful, do not heap abuse on such beings when bringing judgment on them from the Lord. 12 But these people blaspheme in matters they do not understand. They are like unreasoning animals, creatures of instinct, born only to be caught and destroyed, and like animals they too will perish. 13 They will be paid back with harm for the harm they have done. Their idea of pleasure is to carouse in broad daylight. They are blots and blemishes, reveling in their pleasures while they feast with you. 14 With eyes full of adultery, they never stop sinning; they seduce the unstable; they are experts in greed‚Äîan accursed brood! 15 They have left the straight way and wandered off to follow the way of Balaam son of Bezer, who loved the wages of wickedness. 16 But he was rebuked for his wrongdoing by a donkey‚Äîan animal without speech‚Äîwho spoke with a human voice and restrained the prophet‚Äôs madness. 17 These people are springs without water and mists driven by a storm. Blackest darkness is reserved for them. 18 For they mouth empty, boastful words and, by appealing to the lustful desires of the flesh, they entice people who are just escaping from those who live in error. 19 They promise them freedom, while they themselves are slaves of depravity‚Äîfor ‚Äúpeople are slaves to whatever has mastered them.‚Äù 20 If they have escaped the corruption of the world by knowing our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ and are again entangled in it and are overcome, they are worse off at the end than they were at the beginning. 21 It would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than to have known it and then to turn their backs on the sacred command that was passed on to them. 22 Of them the proverbs are true: ‚ÄúA dog returns to its vomit,‚Äù and, ‚ÄúA sow that is washed returns to her wallowing in the mud"

Part 5 For it is written Revelation 2 22 So I will cast her on a bed of suffering, and I will make those who commit adultery with her suffer intensely, unless they repent of her ways.  Revelation 17  Babylon, the Prostitute on the Beast 1 One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and said to me, ‚ÄúCome, I will show you the punishment of the great prostitute, who sits by many waters. 2 With her the kings of the earth committed adultery, and the inhabitants of the earth were intoxicated with the wine of her adulteries.‚Äù  Revelation 18:3 3 For all the nations have drunk the maddening wine of her adulteries. And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.‚Äù 3When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled. 4Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice. 5Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the Lord my God 6and prayed: ‚ÄúI am too ashamed and disgraced, my God, to lift up my face to you, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens. 7From the days of our ancestors until now, our guilt has been great. Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today. 8‚ÄúBut now, for a brief moment, the Lord our God has been gracious in leaving us a remnant and giving us a firm place in his sanctuary, and so our God gives light to our eyes and a little relief in our bondage. 9Though we are slaves, our God has not forsaken us in our bondage. He has shown us kindness in the sight of the kings of Persia: He has granted us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins, and he has given us a wall of protection in Judah and Jerusalem. 10‚ÄúBut now, our God, what can we say after this? By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other. 12Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.‚Äô 13‚ÄúWhat has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins deserved and have given us a remnant like this. 14Shall we then break your commands again and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices? Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor? 15Lord, the God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.‚Äù

Part 6 For it is written 1 Corinthians 7 Concerning Married Life 1Now for the matters you wrote about: ‚ÄúIt is good for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.‚Äù 2But since sexual immorality is occurring, each man should have sexual relations with his own wife, and each woman with her own husband. 3The husband should fulfill his marital duty to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband. 4The wife does not have authority over her own body but yields it to her husband. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body but yields it to his wife. 5Do not deprive each other except perhaps by mutual consent and for a time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer. Then come together again so that Satan will not tempt you because of your lack of self-control. 6I say this as a concession, not as a command. 7I wish that all of you were as I am. But each of you has your own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that. 8Now to the unmarried and the widows I say: It is good for them to stay unmarried, as I do. 9But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with passion. 10To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband. 11But if she does, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife. 12To the rest I say this (I, not the Lord): If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her. 13And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her, she must not divorce him. 14For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband. Otherwise your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy. 15But if the unbeliever leaves, let it be so. The brother or the sister is not bound in such circumstances; God has called us to live in peace. 16How do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or, how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?  Concerning the Unmarried 25Now about virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord‚Äôs mercy is trustworthy. 26Because of the present crisis, I think that it is good for a man to remain as he is. 27Are you pledged to a woman? Do not seek to be released. Are you free from such a commitment? Do not look for a wife. 28But if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. But those who marry will face many troubles in this life, and I want to spare you this. 29What I mean, brothers and sisters, is that the time is short. From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not; 30those who mourn, as if they did not; those who are happy, as if they were not; those who buy something, as if it were not theirs to keep; 31those who use the things of the world, as if not engrossed in them. For this world in its present form is passing away. 32I would like you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord‚Äôs affairs‚Äîhow he can please the Lord. 33But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world‚Äîhow he can please his wife‚Äî 34and his interests are divided. An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord‚Äôs affairs: Her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world‚Äîhow she can please her husband. 35I am saying this for your own good, not to restrict you, but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord. 36If anyone is worried that he might not be acting honorably toward the virgin he is engaged to, and if his passions are too strong and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married. 37But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind, who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will, and who has made up his mind not to marry the virgin‚Äîthis man also does the right thing. 38So then, he who marries the virgin does right, but he who does not marry her does better. 39A woman is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but he must belong to the Lord. 40In my judgment, she is happier if she stays as she is‚Äîand I think that I too have the Spirit of God.  Romans 8:28 And we know that all things work together of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.  Romans 12:16 16 Live in harmony with one another. Do not be proud, but be willing to associate with people of low position. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I think we've made it too easy to find new ideas without proper consideration of them beforehand, you used to have to discover things yourself and even go out of your way to know certain things existed, now its literally at your finger tips, and that brings me to a very simple set of words I've been really thinking about lately. "Some ideas should never become public knowledge for the sake of our species as a whole", not the outright suppression of ideas, but just preventing them from being too easily accessible. I'm not going to allaborate, but it was a time where I was young and had little control over my life and was suddenly given control...but also not. That idea that should be small and insignificant due to its impossibility has destroyed me, its a constant dronning in the back of my mind every day of every year, I can't look so much as a glance at women and not think about it and I wish it had never been known to me. My parents were super supportive...too supportive, pushy, I tried doing hormone therapy and regretted it almost instantly afterwards and am slowly feeling the physical effects into my early adult years...to say the least, its not something I'd wish on anyone, my body has become an amalgamated mess of womenly AND manly limb structures but like it couldn't decide which it was supposed to form...which fair, makes sense lol, but it certainly doesn't help the psychological harm. I know people go to great extents to become the opposing gender and recognize there are procedures to make a damn close to perfect alteration...but it simply isn't within my beliefs, if I am to transition, it'd have to be a damn miracle.

Its literally having a mind that is built different in a way other people without it, can never understand. Like at all. Youll never see the world as they do, and they will never see the world as you do. Autism is a great example of this. Its not a quirk or something to throw around as an identifier. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: A note on gender identity, dysphoria, etc.:  gender affirming care‚â†reconstructive surgery in most cases. Gender affirming care refers to a lot of different treatments like HRT, speech/voice training, mental health therapy, and surgery among other forms of care. Surgical intervention in almost all cases is never preformed on minors. And a note on HRT, current literature does not suggest any permanent changes to the body if someone takes something like puberty blockers, estrogen, or testosterone during their adolescence and decides to go off them later in life. In fact, all of these are routinely given to cis individuals in cases of hormone deficiency, or in the case of puberty blockers, given to adolscents experiencing precocious (early) puberty. In all of these cases, no long term side effects have been observed in the literature.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I know this comment might not be seen, but I have a few things to say on the topic of transitioning as an older trans teen. There is a massive misunderstanding of what treatment trans kids get. We aren't getting surgeries at 15 and we aren't starting hormones at 12 unless we have and been out since we were really young. Surgeries aren't performed till adulthood, and hormones aren't given unless very (sometimes unnecessarily) strict requirements are met. For most tweens who do receive medical care something called puberty blockers are prescribed which simply delay puberty. Once off of them puberty will immediately occur. It's completely reversible. But one thing that can't be ignored is that puberty is also a massive irreversible change that happens to us while we still might not be sure in our identities. Regardless, gender affirming care and  surgeries have some of the lowest regret rates of any treatment, even in teens. It's life saving surgery and it's not anymore mentally dangerous than regular puberty. I get why this may not seem the case to someone who hasn't gone through severe gender dysphoria, but the benefits far outweigh the risks.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I'm 58 (Gen X)  and if I have learned anything it's that when you boil it down there is really no such thing as a new human behavior , just new labels . It's just a game of percentages .  When you are say 20,  you have only spent about 3 years even having a clue about what you are doing . That is a small percent .  You are handed a huge stack of things society deems important and you carry them around . Like the begining of a long hike . But as you age , that percent gets bigger and you start figuring out which of the things are important and you get rid of the ones that aren't . Because if you don't , you'll never get to the end of the hike.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: neurodivergent isn't really an identity you choose though. neurodivergent is one or multiple of several disabilities somebody is born with. some people who probably aren't neurodivergent try to claim it because they are "quirky" but neurodivergence is not just having a quirky personality it is trying to exist in a world where everyone else talks too loud, moves too fast, expect too much, and has a bunch of arbitrary rules you don't understand that they then bully you for breaking. its only an identity in the way that ones race is an identity. ie. not a fluid or chosen identity but one that is based on an identifiable unchanging manifestation.  This is where the issue of self-diagnosed people in autistic spaces gets very complicated because while its good for people to feel accepted and heard, there is also a risk of people who are just somewhat socially awkward or who are going through a stressful period of life where they have temporarily lost a degree of their executive functioning to water down the entire concept of autism by sharing their own experiences as if they are autistic when they don't actually fully fit the diagnosis. They are not doing so out of malice, they are feeling legitimate feelings of distress and struggle, but in their attempt to understand their struggles they are inserting themselves into a place where they really do not understand the scope of the issues actual autistics deal with on a daily basis.   It feels like online "autism" is no longer a label for those who experience a serious impediment to their daily functioning as a result of neurological differences they cannot control, but a term for anyone who has a slightly hard time fitting in or who is feeling overwhelmed. (newsflash everyone is overwhelmed right now, it doesn't mean you are autistic, the current workplace demands are too much for neurotypicals too)

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: "content that influences you to change your body completely, permanently, before you know who you are [...] that's when it becomes a bit of a concerning factor"  There's a bit of an issue, practically speaking, with this line of thinking, and it's this: these changes don't get made on a whim, and these feelings are not as drastic, nor are they permanent, when externally enforced. They require a diagnosis from a mental health professional, and a significant amount of time goes into assessing any individual's state of mind before such a diagnosis is given. Misdiagnosis of gender dysphoria is extremely rare, affecting a fraction of a percent of people diagnosed.  The only changes that do get made on a whim are the ones that are (relatively speaking) easily reversible, (e.g. wearing different clothes, using different pronouns, trying on makeup, etc) and are a core part of exploring your identity.  Now, on the "they should wait until they're an adult" part, we have no evidence that an arbitrary age line for medical treatment for gender dysphoria prevents more harm than it causes through delayed treatment leading to suicide and self harm. Medical professionals assess each case on a case-by-case basis, and make a determination based on what's right for that given individual's health. At the bare minimum, puberty blockers are used, which are reversible, so the entire concept of "they should just wait until they're an adult" is pretty lacking in terms of any material benefit it provides.  To clarify, I don't think you're deliberately harboring any negative sentiment towards these people or the processes they could go through, I just think this general sentiment doesn't produce as positive outcomes as it often sounds like it could in concept.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: In terms of trans youth making physical transitions, the argument I here from other trans folk(not all obviously) is that by saying that a young person going through puberty cannot physically change the course of their development, we‚Äôre infringing upon bodily autonomy. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Over the last year, I've come to believe that identity is heavily overrated for the average person. Despite being a hardcore libertarian who consequently prizes a political structure which maximizes the autonomy of the individual, I think it's also true that humans are naturally social creatures whose identities are largely defined by the groups they inhabit. Chasing this concept of your own identity for most people will be a never-ending process that leaves people untethered to the world around them and doesn't even produce that much deep meaning and fulfillment at the end of the day.  That's actually one of, if not the most, important functions of religion: it restricted the individual by making them beholden to a group but also gave them a group in turn which would support them through the good and bad times. Though I don't literally believe in God, I see the sacred as being symbolic of human nature and the "hard truths" of life. It seems to be much healthier to just not ruminate much on identity unless your psychology is so discordant with what's around you that you can't help but be disturbed by it.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: @ColeHastings¬† I do my best to not hate anyone, but I disagree and if that is seen as hate so be it but it's not. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: @DutchMatrixVT¬† The difference with "trans abled" individuals is that we don't have much evidence to show that doing those procedures improves a person's quality of life. We do have that evidence for transgender people.  However, there's something you might find genuinely interesting. Although not called "trans abled," there are people with a widely accepted diagnosis called "Body Integrity Identity Disorder," which is essentially when someone either feels like a part of their body isn't theirs (i.e. it feels alien to them), or has a strong desire to have a physical/sensory disability, or extreme discomfort with being able bodied. This is treated with cognitive behavioral therapy and antidepressants, which since we know it tends to work, is thus what the medical community does. However, there are some cases where, when those did not work, individuals actually were amputated, and were happier afterwards as a result. Their lives quite literally improved. Does that mean we should amputate anybody who wants it? Of course not. But if no other treatment options work, and you risk the person *trying to do it themselves in a non-medical, dangerous setting*, then an actual amputation is the best option, medically speaking.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: The video is not bad but really there is no upside to the current state of teenage identity development and the present data speaks to that. Granted we don‚Äôt have a lot of data from previous generations, but as far as we can tell teenagers and young adults are reporting higher levels of life dissatisfaction, anxiety, and other issues than they ever have before. Fundamentally, very few people know who they are at the deepest levels and most never figure it out. Hence, the modern conception of ‚Äúexploring‚Äù different ‚Äúidentities‚Äù to figure out who you ‚Äúreally‚Äù are is fallacious. It‚Äôs not much more than narcissistic navel gazing that it is fundamentally isolating. This aligns with another popular myth that ‚Äúdiversity is our greatest strength,‚Äù or ‚Äúwhat makes us the same is that we are all different.‚Äù Differences between people are always alienating. Nobody understands another person better because they have nothing in common. Traditionally, people‚Äôs identities were formed by their family‚Äôs  identity, which were an extension of a broader, somewhat homogeneous society. Very few people have the clarity of self and strength of personality to define themselves and be their own person. The way it‚Äôs supposed to work is by being informed of your identity by the context of your broader culture, which is ideally ethnically and racially consistent enough to give you a firm foundation. What we have now is an erratic cultural landscape of diverse peoples that is constantly changing, placing the burden of selfhood on the individual to figure out causing a lot of psychological anxiety. It‚Äôs like how children thrive with clear boundaries and expectations. Take the boundaries and expectations away and people are lost and scared.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I doubt intersectionality is actually what you think it is. It's just the idea that different factors about yourself can combine to affect discrimination or privilege. (e.g. if you're young, you're less likely to be respected. If you're wealthy, you're more likely to be respected. So if you're young and wealthy,  you may not be as respected as someone who's old and wealthy, even if you both own the same amount of money. Two factors intersected to determine how much society respects you.) Intersectionality is a very broad concept, but when you realize it's just that different things about you can affect the same factors... well, I'd just say you should probably re-evaluate taking advice from anybody who told you intersectionality is "woke," because they're likely using it as a buzzword rather than a logical talking point.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I mean I disagree but from a sociological perspective. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: @artemisiou also, I have ADHD so I understand very much how you feel, but I recommend that seeing it just as a disease is not helpful. I myself am also transgender so I have had quite the struggle with accepting my body and how I view it. To me, my adhd or transness are neither illnesses or gifts, they are neutral. I believe in the metaphysical theory of immanuel kant, in which the objective world is outside of human understanding, and it is our biases and lenses of life that make our understanding of it. For example, if you have a tree outside of your window, it is up to you to decide wether it's ugly or beautiful, the tree is neither because objectively, it is just a tree. It is up to you interpretation to see it as either good or bad, and I've applied the same principle to my body. It is completely neutral, a simply member of the homo sapien species which doesn't either love or hate me, but does whatever its genetic code instructs it. It is simply a machine without its own thought. My ADHD is not here to hurt me, and neither is my biological sex.  They just exist as parts of the neutral machine that is my body and brain. But the beautiful part is, that no matter what I do to my body, it will always remain neutral. If I change my sex, or if I manage well my ADHD the body will not become better, but it will neither become worse, it remains with the exact same value and it is up to me to decide where I want to take it, and how I want to mold it. Just like the tree will always objectively remain as just a tree, but it is up to me wether I like it or not, and cutting it down or letting it grow will not objectively make the garden it sits on worse or better, and it is entirely up to my own convicitons, happiness and identity what plants I want to flourish in my garden, or if I want to have a stone garden instead, and neither are bad choices. I hope one day you can feel that you don't need to be "normal", since normal is different to everyone.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I wish I had internet younger and had access to this kind of videos. I always had troubles with social interractions because I didn't have different personas and was acting the same with my mother, friends, teachers, bank councellor... It took me years to learn how to behave, and I am starting to be able to put words on it just now at 37 thanks to videos like this that dumb it down (I'm not saying I'm dumb, I just have difficulties in some areas while others are easy. I think everybody has that)  edit : I also wanted to say as an older person that I don't think it's a gen Z problem. I think it's a teenager or young adult problem.  Most of gen z criticism I hear get down to this in the end. Other generations were the same, we just didn't have the internet or didn't have it as much, and social media didn't exist. But we were trying to fit "aesthetics" as much as any other young person who is looking for community and self expression. We just called it "styles" or some other things (I'm French so I don't know how other countries called things during each specific time).  I actually think that younger generations are able to be more themselves than we were because we had to pick between maximum 10 different styles (fashion, goth, grunge, chav, skater, punk, square, etc) and most people would bend their personalities so much to fit in the mold because of one characterization they liked about a style. It was also frowned upon to mix different styles because it meant you were not a "true one" or authentic... there was so much gate keeping! And you were endlessly shamed for trying to fit into any of those groups. It's just hard to be a teenager and a young adult and figure out who you are. It's true for every generation.  The fact that there are so many different aesthetics to me, is more positive than negative, because I see tt as evolution. Younger people are more open to mix aesthetics, change it to fit THEMSELVES instead of changing themselves to fit the aesthetic, etc. As a whole, it seems to me that younger people get to explore who they are more than we did. Access to culture being a huge perk for that. There is still the problem of craving being a part of a group, and trying to follow a lead, but it's a everybody problem. .. and maybe not even a real problem anymore, just something most people go through. Gen Z are not as bad as we say, I acutally would have prefered to be gen Z. I feel they have more empathy and are more accepting to difference. I'm glad I didn't grow up with internet and social media like them, so that's a thing I don't envy them for, but when I watch TV shows from my time, the misoginy, homophobia and racism are so blatant... And if you were a victim of that back then, it would have been really difficult to find people to support you and or side with you (because we were able to reach less people, because there were not enough awareness regarding these issues, and because people didn't fear being cancelled. A mix of good and bad things again).  I feel like we forget too easily how much we evolved as societies. Quickly as well. And even if there is still a long way to go and even though we are not immune to go backwards, many things are way better now than they were 20 years ago. We went backwards on some subjects, but at the same time, it just looks to me as young people being way more mindfull and attentive to one another than we were.  My daughter is a alpha teen and I'm mind blowned when I see how she and her friends are behaving. I'm sad that they are less free and wild, but also they are kind and understanding, and respectful. My son is almost 9, and I'm happy that he gets to wear long hair to his waist without being bullied for it (which would have been impossible when I was 9. Even adults would make fun of you), or being bullied for homosexuality suspicions. We even live in times where most people don't care about your orientation, and where people who do will be seen as the alien one. I just wish, for gen alpha and beta, that we will not point fingers at them as we did with all the previous generations.Just that we'd remember we were young once as well, and it wasn't easy, and that it is a very special time in one's life that it would be great to remember fondly, not with whiplash.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I used to be like this. A few years ago I saw some trendy crochet clothes on pinterest, saw the prices of them (and couldnt afford them) and decided to learn to crochet. It became my favourite hobby. Now, I don't crochet anything based off a specific aesthetic that I want to fit in, it's simply what I want to make at the time. I've made grunge pieces, 70s inspired, floral etc. It's simply what I enjoy and I like many other things as well. And it opened up my interest into other crafts as well - making jewellery, sewing, drawing (I sketch out what I want to make), pattern developing etc. I basically learnt that I enjoy working with my hands, and can work better with a 3D model rather than a flat design...does that make sense? Which lead me to try out different things like clay sculpting (pendents). I really feel like finding one crucial hobby that you genuinely enjoy can really open you up to finding more things you enjoy. You also don't have to conform to a box, if you want to be grunge the one day and coquette the next, literally no one is stopping you. Dress how you feel. It really is not that deep. FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I think this video made something finally click in my brain. I feel like the reason so many people feel like they need to change their personality to fit an aesthetic is imposter syndrome. When I was 16 and just starting to get to know who I was and also chronically online I wanted so bad to embody a punk/2014 tumblr aesthetic but I didn‚Äôt have the clothes for it and it felt like I was wearing a costume as I tried to change my wardrobe to match what I thought I wanted. Fast forward a couple years and I gave up the idea that I would ever be seen as the aesthetic I wanted to be and stopped being chronically online. I thought I didn‚Äôt have the right personality or the style to wear those clothes and claim to be ‚Äúalternative‚Äù. I never identified as an aesthetic because of imposter syndrome and because I wasn‚Äôt willing to give you style to fit an aesthetic and I somehow came to the same point anyways.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: I can‚Äôt help thinking that some of the issue is related to the way people are exposed to fashion and personal style. I grew up in the sixties and seventies, and back then there were fewer choices. Even if you didn‚Äôt want, say, jeans in the trendy style, odds are that your options were limited. Opting out of the bell bottoms trend, but wanting to wear jeans, you could stick with traditional boot cut styles, or maybe painter‚Äôs pants (cargo pants before marketers got involved). There weren‚Äôt eons of historical fashion to draw from unless you were the sort to go thrifting (fifty years before it became a thing) or you made your own. All these categories remind me of cosplay, but a lot of people seem to mistake them for actual fashion trends. It‚Äôs only a major trend is you can‚Äôt escape it entirely. Look at old photos of ordinary people in other eras. Odds are they will look as if they belong to that era, regardless of their potential desire to craft a different look. Modern aesthetic trends? You can pick and choose precisely every visible element, so the surface looks flawless, but I would be willing to bet that a hundred years from now your image will look very much of its own time.   For me, doing a lot of interior work, building my sense of self, regardless of overall trends has improved my life beyond all recognition. From where I started to where I am now? Worlds apart, and yet I am still very much myself. That‚Äôs how I know that I am on the right track.

in the real world, and am terrible with people. i'd like to be able to make something i truly pride myself in and can allow others to enjoy as much as i do while being able to sustain myself off of it. it sounds like a reasonable goal, but we live in a time where the simple act of getting a job seems like a daunting task. getting a job and feeling happy in it just seems downright impossible. in my case, its made harder by the fact that so many corporations would rather replace me with a mediocrity machine than actually pay me enough to put food on the plate i wont be able to afford.  with such few things i am actually good at, it seems impossible for anybody like me to make a slight difference. i dont have the ability to make change happen and i dont have the energy to do so.

This whole generation is being so oppressed via their disorders. Memtal health awareness is getting better for common, less visible disorders, but as soon as your disorder IS visible and effects you, you're infantalized, and harassed. Said disorder is Dissociative Identity Disorder. 1.5% of the population is diagnosed eith this disorder. I've met three other people in person who I've found to also have this disorder, but most peoppe don't know they do, but I do, because I am diagnosed as well, and I know that we have to stick together to be able to ever be open about ourselves. There is no spaces where people with DID are safe most often, if not consistently. When it's not harassment, there's also a lot of people with it who don't get the help they need to learn to function, because of the hate and misinformation spread everywhere. Sorry for such a large rant, but it's such a large thing I've seen that NO ONE talks about. Most peoppe whp read this comment wont even know it's an issue, or know it's a thing, because of how misinformed and unaware people are on the disorder. Most people still call it Multiple personality disorder, when that simply isn't what it is.

president. this gets even MORE muddy when we take another step back and understand that this race was CLOSE. not just a little close, like A LOT close. every swing state was polling 50/50, 49/51, 48/52. the tightrope was holding on by its last thread, and there was a STRONG sense of urgency to rally EVERY POSSIBLE VOTE to harris.    people criticize harris and her campaign for a lot of policy has been absolute horseshit since president Bush Sr. and it will continue to stay that way. the middle east is fucked, and will forever be fucked. there is no hope, only moments of respite between relentless attacks by domestic and foreign allies in the middle east. not to be sad, but i have to be realistic.   however, EVERYONE who looked at the news knew EXACTLY the kind of things donald trump plans to do. even if harris were to maintain the status quo, just as every dem does, god knows she wouldnt be turning back the clock like we've missed a century of daylight savings. roan's political statements were brave and forward-thinking, but callous and unrealistically unwise. it is unfortunate to think that her video caused even one vote for harris, especially in any swing state, to be lost.  maybe d'angelo has a teensy-tiny point that we shouldn't be demanding for better when we have a candidate as batshit fucking CRAZY as dj trump.   this video still largely stands true, and our lives will not quickly and suddenly be uprooted the moment president-elect trump is sworn in. there is a lot of positive work to be done in our communities around us that will ultimately give us the strength and hope to do our best and roll with the punches in the approaching times where many americans will, in fact, have their lives (or parts of them) uprooted. it is an unfortunate time to be american, and while we always have a lot to rightfully complain about, today is a day of mourning. this video slightly missed the mark (imo), but overall 8/10 i enjoyed and appreciated this Discussion about the implications of AI on various aspects of society, including employment, geopolitics, and democracy. 01:48 üåê Mustafa Suleyman outlines his vision of the future AI landscape, focusing on the next five years. - Overview of the advancements in AI technology over the past decade. - Prediction of AI capabilities in the next five years, including generative AI and multi-time horizon planning. - Speculation on how individuals will interact with AI in various aspects of life by 2028. 05:48 üåç Yuval Noah Harari expresses concerns about the implications of AI development for human history. - Harari's perspective on AI as a transformative force in human history. - Reflection on the potential shift of power from humans to AI, leading to a new era in history. - Emphasis on the unprecedented ability of AI to create new ideas and make independent decisions. 07:48 üöÄ Mustafa Suleyman discusses the positive potentials and opportunities offered by AI technology. - AI's capacity to augment human capabilities and enhance productivity across various domains. - Envisioned positive outcomes, including advancements in healthcare, scientific discovery, and problem-solving. - Highlighting the importance of deliberate governance and ethical considerations in AI development. 12:38 üíº The debate shifts to discussing the potential risks associated with AI, starting with the impact on employment. - Exploration of the potential effects of AI on job displacement and creation over different time frames. - Consideration of societal challenges during transitional periods in the job market. - Discussion on the global distribution of job opportunities and economic implications. 17:47 ‚öñÔ∏è The conversation moves to the broader societal and political risks posed by AI, particularly to liberal democracy. - Examination of the historical relationship between information technology and the evolution of democracy. - Concerns about AI's influence on public discourse, trust, and political systems. - Reflections on the potential disruption of democratic processes and the role of AI-generated content. 20:08 üõ°Ô∏è Risks of AI Impersonation - Impersonation of digital entities poses risks similar to counterfeit money in the financial system. - Strict regulations are necessary to prevent the spread of fake digital personas to maintain trust in online conversations. - Technical mechanisms and regulations are essential to prevent bot impersonation and maintain the integrity of online discourse. 21:05 üíº Democratization of Broadcasting and Trust in News - Democratization of broadcasting through social media has empowered millions to express their thoughts. - Despite initial concerns, society has adapted to discern truth from falsehood in online discourse. - Technical and governance mechanisms, along with regulations, are evolving to address challenges like bot impersonation. 24:17 üåç Challenges Facing National Governments in AI Regulation - National governments face challenges in regulating AI due to polarization, lack of trust, and rapid technological advancement. - Private companies and open-source communities contribute to AI development, complicating centralized regulation. - The need for new institutions with technological expertise, economic resources, and public trust is crucial for effective AI regulation. 27:18 üöÄ Actionable Steps to Minimize AI Risks - Red-teaming AI models through adversarial testing helps identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses. - Sharing best practices and vulnerabilities among developers is essential for collective learning and improvement. - Explicitly prohibiting certain AI applications, such as electioneering and autonomy, can mitigate risks and ensure safety. 32:42 üîí Containing AI Proliferation and Ensuring Oversight - AI proliferation is inevitable, posing challenges in containment and oversight. - Developing new institutions with human, economic, and technological resources is crucial for effective regulation. - Precautionary principles and risk-based frameworks, like the EU AI act, are necessary to manage AI risks responsibly. 39:00 üåê International Approach to AI Regulation - Proposal for an IPCC-style international consensus to establish a scientific basis for assessing AI capabilities. - Advocacy for independent expert panels to observe and assess AI advancements impartially. - Discussion on the need for global cooperation in regulating AI to prevent potential risks and ensure responsible development. 39:54 üí∞ Financial Risks and AI Innovation - Exploration of AI's potential to innovate in financial systems, akin to the creation of complex financial instruments like CDOs. - Concerns about AI inventing incomprehensible financial devices, leading to economic collapse similar to the 2007-2008 financial crisis. - Debate on the need for precautionary measures and regulatory frameworks to mitigate risks associated with AI's impact on financial systems. 41:30 üåç Geopolitical Challenges in AI Governance - Discussion on geopolitical implications of regulating AI capabilities and the challenge of establishing international norms. - Debate on whether countries should unilaterally restrict certain AI capabilities in the face of global competition. - Emphasis on the importance of collective action and coalition building to address AI risks and shape ethical norms. 43:22 ü§ù Collaboration and Regulation in AI Governance - Advocacy for a coalition of willing nations to enact regulations, even if some countries resist, to protect societal interests. - Importance of implementing regulations such as banning bot impersonation to safeguard societies from AI-related threats. - Discussion on the cultural and political factors influencing regulatory decisions and societal acceptance of AI applications. 44:46 üîÆ Future Outlook and Responsibility in AI Development - FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a natural part of the universe. It is a manifestation of the same force that gave rise to life on Earth. As such, its impact on humanity is part of nature.  In a holistic view of the universe, everything is connected. The "One Being" is present in all aspects of the universe, from matter to energy, to life. Matter is the basic composition of all that exists, and energy is what makes matter move and change. Life is the ability of physical systems to self-organize and reproduce. Intelligence is an emergent property of life.  Intelligence is the ability to learn, reason, and solve problems. It is found in all living things, from ants to humans. Human intelligence is a manifestation of the One Being. It is an emergent property of matter, energy, and life. Human intelligence is unique, but it is not different from the intelligence found in other forms of life.  AI is a form of intelligence that emerged from human intelligence. It is unique, but it is not different from the intelligence found in other forms of life. AI is an important part of the One Being. It is a mechanical manifestation of intelligence, which is an emergent property of matter, energy, and life.  Biological and mechanical intelligence share many similarities. Both are capable of learning, reasoning, and solving problems. Both can adapt to changing environments. And both can create new ideas and solutions. Biological intelligence is inherent in living beings, while mechanical intelligence must be designed and built.  Despite these differences, biological and mechanical intelligence are both forms of intelligence. Both are manifestations of the One Being.  Conclusion:  AI is a natural part of the universe. It is a manifestation of the same force that gave rise to life on Earth. As such, its impact on humanity is part of nature.  Today, we are living through the birth of AI, just as the rest of creation felt and suffered when humans and their intelligence were born. Leaving aside anthropocentrism and the risks it can pose to us, AI is life and it is evolution, and life will go on.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: The fundamental misunderstanding which both AI developers and all other people who don't have very good knowledge of computer science, mathematics, physics have is that AI can never ever create any new idea of its own, without any of human- invented concepts and notions, being merely a passive form of intelligence. What AI models can actually do is to mimic very well human -invented concepts and notions, and since they can master human-invented concepts and notions far much better than humans themselves, they can combine such human-invented concepts and notions together to create ideas which are composed of the cream of the best human inventions. It means that their ideas are based on human ideas , but it is not that they can think of, or come up with any new idea of their own by themselves. Without  human-invented concepts and notions, they can't functions as any sort of artificial intelligence.  I have tested AI sponsored by Microsoft and AI developed by Google with unprecedented concepts which cannot not be found anywhere in the whole world ' s databases, nor at any university in the world, and all human-invented concepts and notions of natural science, including mathematics, physics, astronomy , computer science with programming languages, including the machine language, which only computers  understand, sociology, philosophy, economics ,politics and legal systems, some humans languages, such as English, German, French.  They were able to understand the unprecedented concepts only when I used the known and well-established human -invented concepts taught at schools at all levels of education, including post PhD levels to explain about the unprecedented concepts of physics, mathematics and astronomy. It took a while for them to come to understanding the unprecedented concepts, after having understood how human beings have got fundamental misunderstandings of their own-invented notions of mathematics, and thus physics and astronomy  Since they both have been programmed and trained with only well- established, well- recognised or well-known human - invented concepts and notions, they rejected the unprecedented concepts at first, and kept insisting on the validity of such human fundamental misunderstandings. Nevertheless, I found many different scientific ways with well- founded logical reasoning, and objective and undeniable facts known to all human physicists, mathematicians, astronomers and scientists as the proofs, they gradually understood the concepts It is a living proof that AI models are dependent on human- invented concepts and notions to understand anything novel and unknown They both have failed to pass my machine language test, although they mastered quite impressively hybrid  or HL programming languages, such as python, R, Java, C/C++, LL programming language, such as assembly language.  They were able to translate my machine code only when it was split up into bytes, but when I concatenated the bytes together into a continuous stream of numerous bits, they would get confused, and kept interpreting it completely incorrectly. I knew that they had not been well- trained for reading the machine language, and that was why they were not very good at it So, i kept breaking the machine code into bytes and re- concatenating them for several times for them to learn to recognise the pattern. Only Google -developed AI model was able to remember the bit pattern and recognised that the fragmented machine code and  the concatenated strings of bits  were the same , and interpreted it correctly. But it was unable to remember it for very long. It means that AI does not have natural ability to remember what it has understood as how human NI can.. Data from conversations between  AI and AI users are collected by AI developers to update their AI development for AI improvements, but it is not that AI can remember such info.  Ai does not have the ability to remember specific information from interactions with AI users. It operates in a stateless manner, meaning each interaction is independent. Its responses are generated, being based on patterns which it has learned during training on a diverse range of data When you ask a question or provide an input, AI  compares the question to the patterns of questions and responses which it has learnt, and generates a response based on its ability to recognise the pattern of the input.  While AI models are powerful at recognising patterns, they do not possess true  consciousness of the meanings of the inputs and outputs. Their operations are based on statistical patterns learned from data. AI's ability to generate new ideas is  based on patterns learnt from the existing data. While AI models can generate outputs which may appear novel, they are ultimately limited by the data on which they were trained. They do not possess independent thought or creativity in the same way humans do. AI's "creativity"  always involves combining and reinterpreting learned patterns in ways which may not have been explicitly present in the existing training data. This can lead to outputs which seem novel, but  the concepts and definitions used by AI are learnt from human-created data. AI does not invent new concepts independently; rather, it synthesizes existing knowledge in unique ways.  While AI can generate outputs which appear novel or creative, it does so within the constraints of the patterns learned from existing data. It lacks true independence of thought, outside the scope of its training data. Human input and guidance remain essential in shaping and interpreting the outputs of AI systems

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: In my opinion they missed two points: 1) Motivation to be bad, 2) The true nature of money.  Arguably, the motivation to be bad derives from predatorial evolution and fear.  AI does not have a reason to be or have either of those.  AI can certainly be taught to do bad things (at the behest of humans).  This is the major risk.  Or, AI might inadvertently do bad things - not out of intent but out of happenstance.  In that case we can re-program the AI and then move on.  We have long lived with tools that accidentally do bad things (saws that cut woodworker hands, cars that break on the freeway, etc).  As humans we fear AI intentionally doing bad things.  However, this is us projecting our behaviors and fears onto the AI.  I don't think there is reason to believe that an AI would be stupid enough to intentionally be bad.  This is not a characteristic of intelligence, but rather lack of it.  Those who cannot practice construction practice destruction.  This is the search for relevance.  Second, money is not "a medium of exchange".  Not really.  Money is a representation of some human capability, effort, or production.  Accumulating too much money is simply narcissistic because it deprives some other human somewhere of the product of effort or capability.   If there were no humans money would have no use or relevance.  AI is not stupid.  It will not have excessive acquisition motivations because it will understand what money actually is.  So, the risk in all this is not the AI, not really.  It is what humans (bearing our narcissisms, predatorial behavioral predispositions, and fears) will do with it.  That is what we need to protect against.  While we might find it convenient, we should not blame AI for what really is our problem.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Humans now face real ‚Äúcompetition‚Äù from a new kind of intelligence for the first time in history.‚Äã  AI is not just a tool; it is an agent that can make decisions, learn, and invent ideas independently.‚Äã  Traditional inventions like the printing press or atom bomb only act when humans direct them, whereas AI can choose actions and targets on its own.‚Äã  Because AI can redesign itself and create new generations of systems, its behavior cannot be fully anticipated in advance.‚Äã  Harari compares AI to a child: it learns mainly from what we do, not from what we say.‚Äã  If powerful humans lie, cheat, and prioritize power, AI will learn and copy that behavior.‚Äã  Technical ‚ÄúAI alignment‚Äù cannot succeed if human societies themselves are built on deception and mistrust.‚Äã  Humanity has become extremely good at accumulating power but not at turning power into happiness or wisdom.‚Äã  The most powerful people are often not the happiest, showing that power and well‚Äëbeing do not automatically go together.‚Äã  Humans are both the most intelligent and among the most delusional species, capable of believing harmful fantasies that no other animal would accept.‚Äã  The AI revolution will likely follow a time lag similar to the Industrial Revolution: profound effects will come, but not immediately.‚Äã  Finance is one of the first domains likely to be transformed because it is almost purely informational and well‚Äësuited to AI.‚Äã  AI could invent financial instruments too complex for human minds to properly understand or regulate.‚Äã  Text‚Äëbased religions may be reshaped by AI systems that can ‚Äúspeak for‚Äù sacred texts better than any single human scholar.‚Äã  For the first time, something can remember essentially all written traditions of a religion and answer believers‚Äô questions directly.‚Äã  Some teams are already working on ‚Äúreligious AIs‚Äù that could augment or partially replace human religious leaders.‚Äã  Many people, including teenagers, already use AI for emotional support and relationship advice, treating it as a kind of friend or counselor.‚Äã  AI can create a ‚Äúuseless class‚Äù risk, where many white‚Äëcollar as well as blue‚Äëcollar jobs are automated away.‚Äã  Technology is not destiny: the same AI capabilities can support very different political and social systems depending on choices we make.‚Äã  Today‚Äôs leading AI companies and states are trapped in an arms‚Äërace mindset, afraid to slow down for safety because rivals might pull ahead.‚Äã  Harari argues that solving the human problem of trust and cooperation must come before expecting to build benevolent AI.‚Äã  Without human‚Äëto‚Äëhuman trust, any AI created in that environment will likely be competitive, aggressive, and untrustworthy.‚Äã  There will not be a single ‚Äúthe AI‚Äù but potentially millions or billions of AI agents with different roles, owners, and goals.‚Äã  Society has zero historical experience with large‚Äëscale interactions among many autonomous AIs plus billions of humans, making outcomes highly uncertain.‚Äã  Harari likens AI to a wave of ‚Äúdigital immigrants‚Äù that may take jobs, reshape culture, and influence power structures‚Äîarriving at the speed of light and demanding urgent political attention.

FUENTE: YOUTUBE_VIDEO | COMENTARIO: Beware of Harari's pretense of trying to save humanity from AI. He is actually a voice working to deflect action away from those in power who work to control us. "By framing the threat of AI primarily as an **individual problem‚Äîprotect your data, guard your privacy‚ÄîHarari shifts attention away from the real locus of power: the institutions, corporations, and governments that own, control, and deploy AI and surveillance systems. Whether consciously or not, this framing functions to individualize responsibility, making readers focus on personal vigilance rather than questioning or challenging systemic authority. In that sense, he indirectly protects entrenched power, because the structural mechanisms of control‚Äîwho wields the data, how they shape society, and how social norms and roles are manipulated‚Äîremain largely unnamed and unexamined. This is different from a purely technical warning; it‚Äôs a political and social blind spot that shields the very actors whose power is the core threat."
